learning_outcomes.description: Frame and solve a scientific problem using the appropriate numerical techniques.
Understand the derivation, error analysis, and expected performance of the basic methods in scientific computation.
Translate the numerical method into a computer algorithmand code
Model problems with differential equations and obtain and interpret accurate numerical solutions to these problems
Understand and implement methods for solving boundary value problems
Understand and implement numerical methods of solving partial differential equations
Understand and implement numerical methods of interpolation and integration
Demonstrate written communication skills appropriate for scientific reports.

assessments.task_description: Students will hand in solutions to a number of questions on the theory and applications of numerical methods.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Prepare your assignment as a single pdf file, either by typing it or by scanning your handwritten work. Name your file MATH3201_sxxxxxxx_surname.pdf. Ensure that your name and student number appear on the first page of your submission. Check that your pdf file is legible and that the file size is not excessive (aim for less than 2MB). Files that are poorly scanned and/or illegible may not be marked. Upload your submission using the assignment submission link in Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: The final examination in this course will be held during the end-of-semester examination period. It will be an in-person exam held on campus. Students will not be asked questionsÂ on MATLAB- or Python-specific code, scripts or functions.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 13(24 Feb - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Lecture Series

You will complete a 3-times weekly lecture series covering the theory and applications of computational methods introduced in this course.
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture Series You will complete a 3-times weekly lecture series covering the theory and applications of computational methods introduced in this course.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 2 To Week 13(03 Mar - 01 Jun)
learning_activities.topic:
Practicals in Numerical Implementation

You will complete a weekly practical in addition to the lecture series.
learning_activities.topic_description: Practicals in Numerical Implementation You will complete a weekly practical in addition to the lecture series.
